title: Families First of Georgia
text:
Families First is a non-profit family service agency that serves the <a href="Georgia%20%28U.S.%20state%29">State of Georgia</a> and assists over 40,000 children and families each year with solutions that aim to improve child well-being and family self-sufficiency. The program dates to 1890, beginning as an orphanage for homeless girls.
Mission.
Since its inception in 1890, the agency has addresses community needs such as <a href="abandoned%20child">abandoned</a>, <a href="child%20abuse">abused</a> and <a href="child%20neglect">neglected</a> children; <a href="Teenage%20pregnancy">teen pregnancy</a>; <a href="domestic%20violence">domestic violence</a>; <a href="poverty">poverty</a>; <a href="health">health</a> issues; <a href="homelessness">homelessness</a> and broken families.
Families First's mission is to ensure the success of children in jeopardy by empowering families. The agency aims to focus on three impact areas:
Families First is a member of the <a href="The%20National%20Crittenton%20Foundation">Crittenton</a> family of agencies.
